messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 1204
messages.msgSnippet: I once stopped a woman from breaking a branch from one of the bushes in my front yard. She was going to use it to hit her grandchild. grrrr... Spanking makes
messages.messageBody:
I once stopped a woman from breaking a branch from one of the bushes
in my front yard. She was going to use it to hit her grandchild.
grrrr...

Spanking makes the child resent the spanker. They forget what they
were being spanked for. Experience talking here.

love, Valerie



--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Wendy Silver" <wew99@s...> wrote:
> Hi,
> I am writing, because I was spanked as a child. I was taken in
the yard
> and told to find a stick so my sweet little mom could hit my legs
with it.
> Is all sounds so ridiculously funny to me now. I don't remember it
actually
> scaring me out of doing something, because I was determined to do
what I
> wanted anyway. Emotionally damaged? I don't think so, although I
did use it
> to my advantage to instill guilt when I was an obnoxious teenager,
and was
> getting all the school psychology stuff. People would come in and
ask
> students how they would feel? did this or that happen? I did buy
into that
> and started to really take self pity on myself, and scream at my
parents
> about their poor skills as parents. What a brat! Now, I am too busy
to even
> worry about woes of my childhood. I think spanking is very
ineffective. It
> only makes the parent feel worse than even the child,my dad always
> apologized for days after he would spank me. I don't think it does
anything
> to modify behavior. Maybe it stops a behavior short term by
humiliating the
> child into a quiet state.
> Wendy wew99@s...
>
> Home is the dearest spot on earth, and it should be the center,
though not
> the boundary or the affections.
> -Baker Eddy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1204
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I am writing, because I was spanked as a child. I was taken in the yard and told to find a stick so my sweet little mom could hit my legs with it. Is all
messages.messageBody:
Hi,
I am writing, because I was spanked as a child. I was taken in the yard
and told to find a stick so my sweet little mom could hit my legs with it.
Is all sounds so ridiculously funny to me now. I don't remember it actually
scaring me out of doing something, because I was determined to do what I
wanted anyway. Emotionally damaged? I don't think so, although I did use it
to my advantage to instill guilt when I was an obnoxious teenager, and was
getting all the school psychology stuff. People would come in and ask
students how they would feel? did this or that happen? I did buy into that
and started to really take self pity on myself, and scream at my parents
about their poor skills as parents. What a brat! Now, I am too busy to even
worry about woes of my childhood. I think spanking is very ineffective. It
only makes the parent feel worse than even the child,my dad always
apologized for days after he would spank me. I don't think it does anything
to modify behavior. Maybe it stops a behavior short term by humiliating the
child into a quiet state.
Wendy wew99@...

Home is the dearest spot on earth, and it should be the center, though not
the boundary or the affections.
-Baker Eddy
